inn1.comm: angled across Strauss, leaves it alone, that's a bit of a warm-up delivery from Lee
pushed across Strauss again, leaves it alone again
swings down leg, Strauss gets it away to fine leg
great start from Denly, Lee strays onto the pads and it's clipped confidently through square leg
shapes away from Denly, who leaves it alone
nudged to cover and can't beat the field
on the pads, Denly wants a single to short fine leg but Strauss sends him back
nudged away to leg
worked away behind square
angled across, Denly who leaves it alone
left alone outside off again
lovely drive from Denly, times this one nicely down to long on via Johnson, who knocks it down at mid on
some real zip from Lee here, he jags one back and beats Denly's inside edge
punched away to point
pushed away to the off side again
pushed away to Hussey at cover point
Lee oversteps now, Denly crunches it into the turf and he'll now get a free hit
oops, Lee sprays this one wide of off, he'll have to bowl that again, AND the free hit remains in play next ball
Denly launches into the free hit and gets a thick edge over the slips, it races away to the boundary
straight-bat defence now
cut away to point, Strauss can't beat the field
that's a cracking shot from Strauss! Short and wide, and at Bracken's pace that's a recipe for runs. He's laced that cut through point, wonderful timing
and there's another boundary, this time Bracken strays to leg, Strauss walks across and glances past the man at short fine leg. Well played, but poor bowling
slower delivery outside off, Strauss defends
bang, short and wide again, Strauss cuts it beautifully behind point for another boundary
slower outside off, Strauss waits on it and guides behind point
Strauss opens the face on this and guides it behind point
banged in short of a length, Denly tries to punch through cover but can't beat the field
90mph or 146kph, right on line and Denly defends
fuller length, Denly drives to mid off
gone! Lee makes the breakthrough and Denly departs to a slightly tame nudge outside off, there's a hint of movement away and his edge is snaffled by White at first slip
left alone outside off
short first up, Strauss cuts straight to point
Strauss helps another one on its way, Johnson bowls on the pads and Strauss flicks it comfortably through square leg
oops, Johnson nearly had one there, some movement back in to Strauss, who looks to drive through off and gets a thick inside edge not far from the stumps
angled across Bopara, who pushes to cover
straighter ball, Bopara gets off the mark with a delicate nudge to midwicket where he can take a quick single
left alone outside off
short and tucks Bopara up, but it's an overstep and once again Lee gives away a free hit
slower ball for the free hit, it's fullish as well, Bopara clips it over wide midwicket but doesn't quite time it well enough to reach the boundary
short again, Bopara gets down over it to defend
edged and just short! A genuine edge from Bopara, Ponting at second slip dives to his right and does well to make a stop on the half-volley, that could have been a boundary otherwise
Lee is around the wicket, Strauss defends
Strauss really opens the shoulders here, trying for a big drive through off, but the bump ball finds the man at cover
driven to short cover
full and wide, Bopara drives straight to cover
nudged away through the gap at midwicket
short outside off and slower, Strauss works it to point
fuller ball now, Strauss slashes outside off and clunks it straight down into the turf
some aggression here from Strauss, he steps forward almost Matthew Hayden-like and then closes the face to work it through midwicket, really well played to a ball that was 93mph or 149kph
full face of the bat this time, driven back to the bowler, who doesn't take it cleanly and the deflection allows a single
wide and full, Strauss drives hard but straight to point
oh, is that a chance for Paine? Short and straight, Strauss looks to hook but it's on him too quickly, off the glove and just wide of Paine's right glove, he was diving but it was a few inches away
worked away to leg
angled in to the stumps, Strauss clips it through midwicket and that brings up England's 50
Bopara is forward and defends
Lee tries for the yorker, but it's just down leg, Bopara does well to get a fine little glance on that and it runs away for a boundary
that's a loosener from Watson, but Strauss is well and truly loose already and rocks back to pull a short one through midwicket with power
swing and a miss this time, outside off and Strauss was looking to cut
straighter this time, Strauss leaves one just outside his off stump

quick single, very quick and almost a run-out chance. Strauss nudges behind point and the throw to the striker's end misses, and finds Bopara in his ground anyway. Strauss was dawdling a touch though, so the throw probably went to the wrong end
slower ball, driven to mid-on
short of a length, Bopara punches to mid off
wrong line again from Johnson, down leg and Strauss works it wide of fine leg
oh, Strauss has gotten away with one here. He's tried to hook this from chest height, the extra pace and bounce does him and the ball lobs up off the top edge, just short of midwicket
angled across Bopara, who drives well but straight to cover
straighter line, Bopara clips through midwicket
slower ball, full outside off and it's driven to cover
Strauss works to midwicket and gets through for a quick single, despite an accurate through displacing one of the stumps at the bowler's end
driven away through cover, there's a man in the deep
half a shout there, bat and pad close together, but Bopara got enough wood on that - and before the pad, too - that he can get a single through square
cut away to point
prodded to the leg side
too wide and short, Strauss cuts it away and the man at deep cover does the sweeping
short and well directed, Bopara is tucked up and manages to work it behind square, really good running between the wickets gets him two
opens the face and guides a single down to third man
bunted back down the pitch with a dead bat
slower ball, on line, and Bopara does well to nudge to mid-on and sneak a very sharp single, he's really putting the pressure on the fielders
straight-bat defence from Strauss
angled in with a hint of swing, Strauss drives to mid on
shorter and Strauss pulls through midwicket
driven away through point, good confident play from Strauss
wrong line, down leg and Bopara gets enough on that to get a boundary to fine leg
straight bat from Bopara, who pushes back down the pitch
slower ball on the pads, Bopara works it through square leg
Strauss opens the face once again and picks up another single
probing outside off, Bopara gets it away off a thickish edge to third man
tossed up outside off, Bopara defends
play and a miss! Bopara drives outside off and can't get bat on a straight ball, Pain whips the bails off but Bopara's back foot hadn't been raised
that's well played, Bopara gets this one through cover with a big stride down the pitch, nobody out on the boundary there
a slight mix-up there, Bopara wanted a single to leg and Strauss sent him back
a big backlift from Bopara, driving to cover
thick edge now, Bopara looking to drive again, only succeeds in getting it to backward point
angled across Strauss, who guides behind point
Strauss picks up his half-century with a confident pull straight through square leg
Strauss defends outside off
wide of off, Strauss guides it away to third man
straight ball, Bopara defends
pushed away to the off side again
down leg, Strauss can't beat short fine leg
drifting down leg again, Strauss pushes through midwicket
Hauritz gives this a lot of air, Bopara waits and works it through leg
right on line, not much spin, Strauss nudges to leg
Strauss advances, that came from nowhere, and he's not managed to get much bat on that
tossed up on line, Strauss defends
nudged away through point for a single
worked away through square leg and they think about a second run, Johnson misfields, and so they do take that second, good hard running from Strauss and Bopara
guided away behind point
short outside off, Strauss on the back foot crunches it away through cover
Bopara is solid in defence, pushing to cover
driven straight to Clarke at point
well flighted by Hauritz, Strauss waits and defends
Strauss sweeps from outside off, it's flown off the top edge and lobs just short of Mike Hussey at deep square leg
Hauritz gets rid of Bopara! Spinning in a fraction, Bopara looks to sweep and is struck in line with off stump, Nigel Llong sends him on his way
Hauritz gives this a lot of air, outside off and Prior jams the bat down on it
edged and just short of slip! Prior plays for the spin that isn't there, angles the bat down though, so it's not reached White at first slip
worked away to square leg
meanwhile, Strauss continues to tick the scoreboard over, he cuts a single away behind point
Prior gets off the mark with a flick behind square
fuller length, Strauss clips a single through midwicket
dead straight this time, Prior gets in behind to defend
80mph or 129kph, beats the bat outside off. Prior was looking to open the face and guide it to third man, but there is a slip in place, so he's perhaps lucky he didn't make contact
guided away through point
flatter ball, Prior pushes to the off side
driven to mid on
flighted and a hint of turn, Prior clips to midwicket
driven to cover, Prior can't beat the field
almost sneaks one through Prior, some turn in from outside off, Prior just gets the bat down to guide it to leg
turned away to mid on and that's good running once again
slower ball from Bracken, Strauss waits on it and pushes to off
beats the bat this time, Bracken rolls the fingers on that one and Strauss looks to guide behind point, and can't quite get it
solid in defence this time
nudged to point, they take off for a quick single and Clarke's throw to the bowler's end misses
Prior clips to midwicket
square drive from Prior, who beats the man at point
yorker length, Prior prods back to Hauritz
swept away through square leg
well bowled, Strauss looks to sweep, Hauritz holds it back and beats the bat, Paine whips the bails off but Strauss was safe
worked to midwicket
this time Strauss does get the sweep away, through square leg
some turn there, in towards the off stump, and Prior clips to mid on
on the pads, worked to midwicket
Strauss advances, then prods back to the bowler
short and pulled away but there's a man at deep midwicket to prevent the boundary
shortish again, punched down the ground to long-on
no turn from Clarke, Strauss clips it through square leg
soft hands from Prior, who guides behind square leg
spins in to Prior, who nudges to leg
Prior launches into a big swing, then checks his shot and pushes to off
nurdled down through mid-on for a single
Strauss goes for 63! He's gone for a slightly premeditated slog over midwicket, but the ball turns a touch and skies off his top edge, Bracken at short third man takes a comfortable chance
turns in to the pads, Prior works to square leg
angled across Shah, who pushes to off
Clarke gets some curve in there, but Prior is good enough to rock back and cut behind point for a couple
clipped away towards fine leg
straight bat from Shah, who prods it back to Clarke
Shah's off the mark, with a less-than-convincing shot. It's straightening just a touch and runs away to third man off a thick edge
on the back foot and pushes to mid on
drifting in to Shah, who drives square
angled across Shah from around the wicket, he's launched an expansive drive that finds Clarke at cover
no idea. Shah had no idea about that. Drifting across him, he's looked to work it to leg and the ball lobs up short of slip, but Shah's looking to leg to try and find the ball
worked away through square leg
Prior walks across his stumps and nudges to leg
driven to long-on for a single
tossed up on line, Shah with that busy backlift of his drives past the bowler for a single
no spin from Clarke, Shah prods it through point
drifting in to Prior, who pushes and takes off for a quick single, well judged run in the end
thumped away to deep cover
driven to cover
and there's a boundary, the first for 75 deliveries. Prior gets back to a quicker and flatter ball and cuts behind point
nudged away through leg
Prior waits on it again and cuts to deep point, there's a man out to mop up
oh dear, a no-ball from the spinner, nudged to leg for no run
well bowled, he's jammed it in for a yorker-length ball that doesn't leave much option but a drive down the ground
worked away to cover
turns in to Prior, who drops it at his feet
quicker, looking for an lbw with Prior walking across his stumps, but he's good enough to clip it away through square
cut to point
Prior opens the face and guides a single to third man
angled onto the pads, Shah works a single through square leg
defended to cover
on the pads, it's worked away for a leg bye behind square leg
Shah waits on this one again and guides to third man
soft hands there, nudging a single to midwicket
cut away through point
Hauritz holds it back again and Shah nudges to leg
pushed away to the leg side again
turns in again, worked to leg
tossed up and beats the edge! A groan from Paine as he sees how close that was to Shah's bat
punched back down to long-on
Shah goes for a drive outside off,  it beats the bat and Paine, up to the stumps, can't glove it cleanly
Tim Paine appeals, he's whipped the bails off after the ball beats the outside edge. Llong asks for a replay but the foot was never raised and Prior was always safe
is that the Dilscoop? I think you'd call that Prior decision-making. He's walked across and flicked it over his shoulder for a boundary to fine leg
pushed away to the off side
slower ball from Bracken, Prior drives to long-off
slower again, 107kph in fact, and it's pushed back down the pitch
Lee strikes first ball! That's a perfect, fast yorker that angles in and Prior, used to the spin, doesn't get the bat down in time and loses his middle stump
Lee goes for the yorker again, but it's wide of off and Morgan gets bat on that
angling in and left alone outside off
angles the bat and guides to point
Lee tries for the inswinging yorker and Morgan pushes to off
short of a length now, nudged to cover
angled across Shah, who pushes to off
quick single for Shah, who pushes to cover and takes off, that's a good call
banged in short, Morgan looks to cut and slams it straight down into the pitch
swinging in to Morgan, who can't beat short midwicket

big lbw shout but Asad Rauf has called that runs off the bat. Fast inswinging yorker, it doesn't look like it has come off Morgan's bat, just pad, and might've taken leg. But, he's off the mark, and he'll take it
worked off the hips behind square
a little bit of turn, Shah defends
Shah thinking about an aerial shot there, but checks it and defends
beats the edge once again, with a delivery that simply doesn't turn

Tim Paine is absolutely convinced this is caught behind, but nobody else on the ground is. Hauritz barely appealed, Llong wasn't interested, but Paine was so convinced he started to run down to Hauritz
pushed down to long-on for a single
beats the bat with an offspinner
cut away to deep cover for a single
Morgan looks to work it through leg, but can't get bat on ball
pushed away to point and can't beat the field
pushed back down the pitch defensively
Morgan waits on this and cuts late, down to Lee at third man
straight bat from Shah, pushes back to Watson
short and almost curtains for Morgan! He's pulled that one but it's too quick for him, hits high on the bat and lobs up just wide of White at short midwicket
on the pads, Shah works a single to midwicket
and Morgan finally gets one away, a punchy drive wide of mid-on to a delivery that was a touch too full
pushed away to leg
hooked away to fine leg for a single
pushed to mid on
guided away to point, no urgency from Morgan
pushed to cover for no run
nudged away fro a quick single to the off side
thumped away to the boundary, that's a powerful, if not very pretty, pull from Shah, who beats a diving Hussey at deep midwicket
almost another Shah-related run-out! Pushed to cover and Shah takes off, Hauritz throws to the bowler's end but misses the stumps by a margin, with Shah well out of his ground
beats the bat, well bowled, angling across Morgan
driven down towards long-off for a single
punched away for another single
Johnson strays onto the pads and Shah works it to fine leg
thick edge, shouts of 'catch it' as the ball flies wide of gully and down towards third man, Morgan gets back for two
flicked away behind square leg
angled across Shah, who clunks a drive out to deep cover
driven away to deep cover for another single
Morgan looks to cut outside off and can't get bat on ball
offcutter, this one jags back in to Morgan, who misses his attempted cut again

wonderful stumping! Superb work from Paine, up to the stumps to Bracken. It's a wide down leg side, Morgan looks to flick and misses the ball, and lifts his foot in the process. Paine collects and whips the bails off very smartly. Morgan's foot is on the line, and the third umpire gives that out.
Wright gets off the mark immediately with a confident drive through cover
another single, driven out through cover
nudged straight to Ponting at cover
Johnson tries for the inswinging yorker, Shah manages to work it away for a single
Wright is on the back foot, punches to cover
bouncer, and Johnson's probably lucky that wasn't called a wide, it looked to be too high for Wright
fast, Johnson troubles Wright here, he's jammed the bat down to send a bump ball Paine's way
fullish ball outside off, Wright drives just forward of point
slower ball this time, Shah cuts it away to deep point
yorker to start, really well bowled, Shah gets a single away to cover
ah, well played Luke Wright! He's whacked that one straight back over Lee's head, it was the slower ball and Wright timed that wonderfully
full and outside off, Wright pushes a single to mid off
full toss on the stumps, Shah is frustrated at himself for not finding a gap, he's pinpointed midwicket
good shot, Shah gets a bouncer and goes back to pull that one with power through midwicket, when he plays that shot it looks ugly but it certainly is effective
yorker, Shah can't beat the man at a deepish mid off
pushed away to cover, Shah can't beat the field
Shah backs away now and gets a full toss that he cracks through cover, well directed
backs away again and Watson follows him, Shah whips it to deep midwicket
and Wright pierces the off side this time! Full and wide of off, Wright backs away and splits the men forward and backward of point, again that's excellent placement
straighter line now and it's driven to mid off
full outside off and beats the bat
Another terrific yorker! Lee gets through Wright with a fast, full ball that angles in, beats the outside of the bat and slams into Wright's off stump
Broad gets runs immediately, flicking the ball behind square and it's good running as he gets back for a second
Lee gets another! This one takes Broad's leg stump, it was fast and full, Broad was backing away and just didn't get bat on ball.
yorker again, it was on line but Rashid has done well to keep that out
too full this time, Rashid pushes it back to the bowler
95mph or 153kph, that's a great yorker but Rashid has done well to keep it out and in the process squeezes the ball just past the diving wicketkeeper for a boundary. Great result for England, there.

is this out? The umpires converse and decide that, yes, that was a legal ball. They were checking on the height, it was a full toss around waist height, Shah pulled and mistimed, finding Ferguson at midwicket
beats the bat outside off
punched away to point
clunked away towards third man, Paine sets off to chase and Bresnan manages to get back for two
Bresnan gets a couple more, drives that one out to deep cover and Hussey slides to make the save
slower ball, Bresnan skies it out towards deep cover but it's short of Mike Hussey
worked away for a single to leg
bouncer, Rashid ducks underneath it

another yorker and another wicket for Lee! Superb bowling, fast, straight and simply too good for England's lower order. Rashid was backing away a touch to try and work it through off, but it's dead straight and crashes into middle stump
full toss, and too full to trouble Sidebottom. Beats the bat, and gives Paine an awkward bounce to collect
fast and straight, Sidebottom nudges it through cover to get off the mark and off the strike
yorker, kept out by Bresnan, and it's a no-ball, so Lee gives away a free hit
Bresnan makes use of the free hit by backing away and driving a full ball through cover to the boundary, well done by Bresnan
Sidebottom pushes to point and hares through for a single
tucks Bresnan up with one on the hips, he swivels a pull behind square
Johnson finishes the innings! Sidebottom misses a straight one and Johnson's too fast, it crashes into middle and leg

inn2.comm: Australia are away immediately, Watson opens the face and guides a single to third man
Paine gets off the mark immediately as well, nudging a single to mid on
lovely shot from Watson, who clips the first boundary of the innings through midwicket
left alone outside off
probing outside off and left alone again
opens the face and gets one wide of the cordon
angled across Watson, who once again steers it deliberately wide of the slips and down to third man
pushed away defensively to point
just outside off, Paine gets the bat down on this one to work to point
beats the bat, well bowled Sidebottom. Paine tries to open the face and doesn't make contact
Paine walks at Sidebottom now, then defends back down the pitch
punched away to cover and can't beat the field
swing and a miss! Broad gets this one to swing away from Watson, who drives well wide of off, and in the end he's missed it by quite a margin
this one doesn't swing and straightens, Watson is squared up and gets it away to the off side
angled in to the stumps again, Watson defends
pushed away towards point
Watson's played that shot plenty of times already today, opening the face and guiding it to third man, Rashid makes a meal of his attempted save, he's knocked that on towards the boundary
pushed away to point
a little width and short, Paine tries for the cut but can't time it
angled across Paine, who defends off the back foot
this time Paine gets it fine of point, but the man in the deep keeps it to a single
Watson gets this off an inside edge away to midwicket
Sidebottom continunes to angle it across the right-handers without any swing, Watson defends
again Watson opens the face and again he gets a single down towards third man
defended outside off
good line outside off, Watson pushes a single towards extra cover
just outside off again, Paine defends
this time Broad strays down leg, Paine gets it away behind square
howzat? Nigel Llong isn't interested, probably heading down leg side. Broad angled it in and it struck Watson in line with leg, but it wasn't straightening enough
some aggression from Watson now, he's got a slightly short one from Broad and pulls over the head of Bopara at midwicket, well played
Paine goes for the pull now, swivels it around the corner to fine leg
Sidebottom again is pushing across Watson, who blocks it away
shorter on the hips, and Watson works it behind square leg
pushed away towards point defensively
on the back foot and Watson drives towards mid on
clipped to mid on and can't beat the field
edged and wide of the sole slip, Paine was on the move there, and got a thick edge away through where a third slip might've been
powerful pull from Watson, he's so quick on those ones. It wasn't terribly short but Watson just clubs it baseball-style in the air between midwicket and mid-on
bouncer, and it's too high for Watson to reach, so Llong calls it wide
Broad tries for the yorker, it's just outside off, Watson jams the bat down and the ball actually slides under the bat, Prior's fumble allows a bye
guided away to third man
angled in to Watson, who whips it wristily just wide of the short midwicket
Paine flashes outside off, Broad beats the bat with one that moves away a touch, not a great shot
well fielded by Morgan at point, Watson sliced away a cut that had some pace on it, but it was nicely chopped off
angled across Watson, who defends
Sidebottom goes for the slower one on the pads, but Watson picks it and clips a single to square leg
and just to add insult to Sidebottom's injury, he's been hooked away over backward square leg for a boundary, well played by Tim Paine
down leg side again and once again Paine walks across to work it wide of the man at fine leg, this time along the ground and that's two consecutive boundaries
beats the bat this time, Sidebottom shifts his line across the off stump and Paine, full of confidence after those two fours, couldn't resist having a flash
full and straight, Watson goes for the straight drive but doesn't time it, and picks up just a single as mid-on runs around to cut it off
and Paine gets a boundary through the off side now, he's cut it hard and square through point, in the air but wide of the fielder
Broad responds with one that moves away a touch and Paine tries to dab it past the slip, but can't make contact
a bit shorter this time, Paine drops it into the off side and thinks about a quick single, then decides against it
crunched straight to the man at cover
Paine advances to Broad, drives it wide of mid-off, who gets across to make the save
cuts it back in to Paine, who guides the ball to point. Now then, Asad Rauf has called a no-ball here, for England having three fielders outside the circle. Dear oh dear.
angled towards leg, Paine works it away behind square
Paine goes for the swivel around leg again, Bresnan wants lbw, but it's sailing a long way over the top
this time Paine waits on one outside off and guides it behind point
Bresnan gets the first breakthrough! Fullish and angling in towards middle, Watson walks across and is struck in line with middle, that would've taken leg stump, says Asad Rauf.
sharpish bounce welcomes Ponting! He's had to drag the bottom hand off the bat there as Bresnan gets one to rise sharply
pushed away to the off side
on target immediately, just a hint of turn from off, and Paine defends
punched away through the off side for a single
drags it down a bit short, Ponting pulls a single to deep square leg
oh boy. That was a horrid ball. Rashid will want to wipe that from his resume. Short, and way, way, way down leg, Paine does well to even get across to get bat on it, helping it to fine leg
squirts another one down leg
short and down leg again, really hasn't got it right yet, Paine helps that to fine leg
much better and almost a catchable one at cover! Tossed up and driven just wide of the fielder
angled in to Paine, who turns it to leg
worked away behind square for a single, they don't take a second on Broad's misfield
straight bat from Paine, who pushes to cover
nudged away towards point
angling down towards Paine's pads, he helps it through square
Ponting pushes hard at one outside off, it goes off a thickish edge down to third man
good line this time from Rashid, tossed up on off, and it's driven through cover
well flighted again, fullish length and pushed back to the bowler
tossed up outside off and Paine premeditates a little dab sweep over his shoulder, safe enough under the circumstances
good ball, turning away and Paine pushes outside off, a thickish edge runs through gully
oops, down leg side and Paine looks to pull, only gets a thin bottom edge on it but it's enough to ensure Prior can't stop the ball running away for four
driven to cover
angled onto the leg stump, Ponting doesn't get bat on ball
pushed away through point and good fielding from Morgan means it doesn't reach the boundary, a nice sliding save
guided down to deep backward square
another great save from Morgan, but plenty more runs on offer as it's guided away through point
bouncer to Paine, who is quickly into position to hook from in front of his eyes down to backward square
Ponting laces this one through point, shortish and outside off, he'll eat those up on most occasions
Rashid gives this some air, Paine prods it back down the pitch
this one stays a bit low and turns away, Paine watches it and defends
a little width there and Paine drives through cover
again Rashid flights it, again Paine drives but this time straight to Wright at short cover
full toss and crunched to Wright again
quicker ball, on line, Paine defends
good shot, lovely pull from Ponting, just a tiny bit short and he's got it wide of deep midwicket
driven away through cover for a single
cut away off a thickish edge down to third man
Ponting goes the cut but clunks it down into the ground and back towards Prior
the runs keep flowing, Ponting works it off leg stump for a lovely glance wide of fine leg
short of a length and Ponting defends
on line from Rashid, Paine defends off the back foot
tossed up outside off and beats the bat
on the pads, Paine dabs it to leg
flighted outside off, Paine drives to deep cover
easy single there, driven to long-off
pushed away to cover
quickish to start, Ponting defends
clipped away behind square leg
drags it down short, Paine whips through square for a couple
driven down to long-on
defended outside off, Shah is bowling flat and quick
prodded away to off once more
turns away outside off and Paine leaves it alone
pushed back down the pitch
good ball, drifts in and turns away, Paine gets a thickish edge away with soft hands
driven away through cover
worked away behind square for a single
that's it for Paine, Rashid gets the breakthrough. He's gone for the dab sweep and a top edge is easily picked up by Prior
flat again, Shah isn't flighting the ball, it's cut away through point
straight ball, Clarke drives and Shah dives across to make a nice save off his own bowling
short, almost a bouncer length in fact, Clarke is annoyed that he couldn't beat square leg
tossed up a touch more, Clarke is forward to defend
Shah really drags it down again, Clarke pushes through point to get off the mark
Ponting defends outside off
Clarke backs away to cut to point
Rashid gives this some good air, Clarke uses his feet and pushes back to the bowler
flighted well outside off, Clarke drives wide of mid off
Rashid drags this down leg, and it's whipped away behind squar
driven away through cover
soft hands, he works it off the pads for a single
driven through cover
no air from Shah, who continues to push it through, Ponting works it through point
guided behind point this time
driven back to Shah
worked away to midwicket
Ponting goes aerial this time, a little wide of off and he's launched it high over extra cover, it bounces inside the boundary and rolls safely away for four
Clarke uses the feet to Rashid, drives to mid off
pushed to leg
nice line, flighted on off and turning a fraction away, Clarke blocks
Clarke uses the feet here, and drives in the air over the bowler's head, it lands safely and rolls away for a boundary
driven through extra cover
shortish, Ponting on the back foot crunches to cover
guided away to third man off the open face
oh, Wright nearly gets Ponting! Angled in and Ponting clips on the up to short midwicket, where Bresnan can only watch it bounce a couple of inches in front of him
short this time and Ponting goes for the hook, safely over square leg
nudge and run there from Clarke, he just dabs that to mid-on and takes off immediately, well judged
cut to point, can't beat the field
Ponting defends towards cover
again Clarke uses the feet brilliantly, makes this into a full toss and drives through extra cover for a boundary
on the back foot this time, works through square leg and they come back for two, it's a tight one but in the end Prior doesn't glove it cleanly and breaks the stumps without the ball in hand
flighted on off, Clarke advances and drives to long off
loopy ball well outside off, it's driven uppishly to extra cover
full toss, bad ball and it's lobbed over extra cover for a single to the sweeper
another full one from Rashid, who's struggling for consistency, and it's driven to long off
shortish, Ponting swivels a pull through square leg
short and wide down leg
clipped away behind square and sharp running gets Clarke two
pushed to mid-off
slower ball outside off, left alone
straight-bat defence from Clarke
solid in defence again
clipped away uppishly to fine leg
dropped? I don't think Strauss got a finger to it at first slip, but it did carry. A genuine edge and Strauss moving low to his left couldn't snare that one
pushed away to leg
clipped away through midwicket
angles in a yorker, but it's kept out
the angle in helps Ponting to work a single through midwicket
driven in the air and that's just over the head of the stretching, leaping Sidebottom at mid-off
pushed away to off
pushed defensively back down the pitch
driven back in the direction of Wright, who gets a hand on that to prevent any runs
nudged towards point
good line on off, Ponting defends
worked away off the hips down to fine leg
driven through cover to the man in the deep
pushed to cover and can't beat the field
cut behind point, Bresnan at third man does the fielding
Ponting prods, point pounces
good ball, Sidebottom around the wicket beats the outside edge with a ball that straightens just enough
on the hips to start, Clarke glances to fine leg
worked to Rashid at fine leg again, he's getting a bit of work in the field
driven to cover
Broad jags this one back in a touch, Clarke defends
angling in to off, Clarke drives to mid-on
drives to mid-on, Clarke takes off for a quick single and gets home easily
Bresnan's angle takes this onto Clarke's pads, he glances fine and that's a poor start from Bresnan
clipped to midwicket
pushed back down the pitch to the bowler
outside off, Clarke pushes to point
punched to cover again
beats the bat outside off
slower ball on off, Ponting defends
Ponting drops this towards the off side and they hare through for a single
short ball, Clarke stands tall and bunts it into the dirt
Clarke looks to advance, pulls it straight to midwicket
oohs and aahs as Clarke chips this one in the air just wide of the lunging Strauss at short midwicket
bouncer, Ponting ducks under it
Clarke angles it to point
Bresnan brings it in to leg, Clarke drives to mid-on
driven to cover, can't beat the infield
pushed away to cover once again, absolutely no urgency from Australia, but there doesn't need to be
ditto, straight to cover
left alone outside off
Ponting flashes outside off, gets it away to deep backward point
yorker, Clarke keeps it out
swivels a pull through square leg
clipped to mid-on, Ponting gets through for a quick single
angled in to Clarke, who defends
Broad tries for the inswinging yorker, but it's full and Clarke clips to square leg
Ponting defends back down to Bresnan
Bresnan continues to go wide of the crease and angle it in, Ponting defends
straight bat from Ponting
gone! Ponting falls short of his half-century, a sharp catch from Bopara at short cover as Ponting tries to go over the top
short riser to welcome Ferguson, he walks across and gets out of the way
Ferguson gets off the mark with an overthrow, he's dropped it to off and wanted to take off for a quick single, the underarm misses the stumps at the striker's end and there was nobody backing up
bouncer, Ferguson ducks
pushed away to point
right on off stump, Ferguson defends solidly
on the back foot, punches to cover
prodded to point
short and Ferguson goes for the pull, the man in the deep cuts it off
pushed to mid-off
worked away with the angle through square leg
tip and run there, Ferguson bunts to off and takes off quickly
straight-bat defence from Clarke
short and down leg, wide is called
opens the face and angles it down to third man
short again, Ferguson ducks, and it's called wide. Tough call, there. Had Ferguson stood tall it would've been around head height
pushed away to cover
crunched to cover, Shah makes a good save
short of a length, Clarke on the back foot pushes to point
driven straight to cover again
Clarke wakes from his slumber with a powerful pull over midwicket, there haven't been too aerial strokes today, but that was a well-executed one
short ball, Clarke gets out of the way, and after some negotiations with his square-leg colleague, Asad Rauf calls it wide
this time Clarke finds the gap at cover, just leans into a drive and Bopara chases it down
jagging back in to Ferguson, who can't get bat on ball
tossed up and Clarke drives through cover
nicely played, Ferguson goes over the top with a lofted drive, a chip really, over mid-off
pushed back to Rashid
Clarke uses the feet again, drives to cover
lovely shot, that's one of Clarke's best for today, he uses his feet to get to the pitch of the ball and drives wide of cover, gets the placement just right
pushed back to Rashid
flicked off the pads to the man at deep square leg
short, and pulled to deep square
Ferguson gives himself some room and throws the bat at it, a thick edge flies to third man, where Shah makes what can only be described as a highly optimistic dive, he was miles from cutting that off
driven to mid-off
short and Ferguson ducks
shapes away from Ferguson, who lets it go
Clarke waits on the back foot and cuts through point
Clarke uses the feet, then pads it away
advances again, and defends
pushed back to the bowler
an optimistic shout from Rashid, Clarke padded up and the ball was turning past off stump
defended again
wide down leg, and called so
down leg again, Ferguson just helps it on its way with a pull that races to the fine-leg boundary
angled across Ferguson, who leaves it
clipped through midwicket
inside edge for four. That rather sums up the day for England.
driven to mid-off for a single
Ferguson whips another pull around to deep backward square
clipped behind square for a single
prodded back down to Stuart Broad
defended back to the bowler
Clarke looks for a cut, can't beat the field
great shot. Clarke places this drive wide of mid-off and it's now four to win for Australia
opens the faces and guides to point
worked away through midwicket for a sharp two
full toss and a leading edge runs to point
Sidebottom goes the yorker, oversteps and gives Ferguson a free hit
and Ferguson can't get the free hit away! Sidebottom jammed it in full and wide, it was driven to mid-off
driven to mid-on for a quick single and that's the match
